name: Table
overview:
This class allows you interact with Google Cloud Bigtable.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Compute Engine

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigtable = gcloud.bigtable();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var bigtable = gcloud.bigtable({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Table
methods.description: Create a Table object to interact with a Google Cloud Bigtable table.

examples.code:
var instance = bigtable.instance('my-instance');
var table = instance.table('prezzy');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: table.delete(function(err, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.code: table.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a table if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

params.name: options.view
params.description: • The view to be applied to the table fields. See bigtable/table#getMetadata.

methods.name: createFamily
methods.description:
Create a column family.

Optionally you can send garbage collection rules and when creating a family. Garbage collection executes opportunistically in the background, so it's possible for reads to return a cell even if it matches the active expression for its family.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: rule.age
params.description: • Delete cells in a column older than the given age. Values must be at least 1 millisecond.

params.name: rule.versions
params.description: • Maximum number of versions to delete cells in a column, except for the most recent.

params.name: rule.intersect
params.description: • Cells to delete should match all rules.

params.name: rule.union
params.description: • Cells to delete should match any of the rules.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: createReadStream
methods.description: Get bigtable/row objects for the rows currently in your table as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing.
Specify arbitrary keys for a non-contiguous set of rows. The total size of the keys must remain under 1MB, after encoding.
Scan for row keys that contain a specific prefix.

Specify a contiguous range of rows to read by supplying start and end keys. If the start key is omitted, it is interpreted as an empty string. If the end key is omitted, it is interpreted as infinity.
Specify multiple ranges.
Apply a bigtable/filter to the contents of the specified rows.

params.name: options.decode
params.description: • If set to false it will not decode Buffer values returned from Bigtable. Default: true.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: • Row filters allow you to both make advanced queries and format how the data is returned.

params.name: options.limit
params.description: • Maximum number of rows to be returned.

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: • Prefix that the row key must match.

methods.name: deleteRows
methods.description: Delete all rows in the table, optionally corresponding to a particular prefix.

examples.caption: You can supply a prefix to delete all corresponding rows.
If you choose to omit the prefix, all rows in the table will be deleted.
examples.code: table.deleteRows(callback);

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.prefix
params.description: • Row key prefix, when omitted all rows will be deleted.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: family
methods.description: Get a reference to a Table Family.

examples.code: var family = table.family('my-family');

methods.name: getFamilies
methods.description: Get Family objects for all the column familes in your table.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

examples.code: table.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.view
params.description: • The view to be applied to the table fields.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: getRows
methods.description:
Get bigtable/row objects for the rows currently in your table.

This method is not recommended for large datasets as it will buffer all rows before returning the results. Instead we recommend using the streaming API via bigtable/table#createReadStream.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options
params.description: • Configuration object. See bigtable/table#createReadStream for a complete list of options.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Insert or update rows in your table. It should be noted that gRPC only allows you to send payloads that are less than or equal to 4MB. If you're inserting more than that you may need to send smaller individual requests.

examples.caption: By default whenever you insert new data, the server will capture a timestamp of when your data was inserted. It's possible to provide a date object to be used instead.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: entries
params.description: • List of entries to be inserted. See bigtable/table#mutate.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.err.errors
params.description: • If present, these represent partial failures. It's possible for part of your request to be completed successfully, while the other part was not.

methods.name: mutate
methods.description: Apply a set of changes to be atomically applied to the specified row(s). Mutations are applied in order, meaning that earlier mutations can be masked by later ones.

examples.caption: Insert entities. See bigtable/table#insert.
Delete entities. See bigtable/row#deleteCells.
Delete specific columns within a row.
Mix and match mutations. This must contain at least one entry and at most 100,000.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: entries
params.description: • List of entities to be inserted or deleted.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.err.errors
params.description: • If present, these represent partial failures. It's possible for part of your request to be completed successfully, while the other part was not.

methods.name: row
methods.description: Get a reference to a table row.

examples.code: var row = table.row('lincoln');

methods.name: sampleRowKeys
methods.description: Returns a sample of row keys in the table. The returned row keys will delimit contigous sections of the table of approximately equal size, which can be used to break up the data for distributed tasks like mapreduces.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: sampleRowKeysStream
methods.description:
Returns a sample of row keys in the table as a readable object stream.

See bigtable/table#sampleRowKeys for more details.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing.
